alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 05 at 3:09PM CDT until October 07 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...Friday night into Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas near and west of Highway 281 have the highest chance to see a hard freeze with temperatures below 28 degrees.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
